intro: Polygala schirvanica, commonly known as the Schirvan's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, bean-like fruits. Polygala schirvanica is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
